First Aid.summary: Learn how to respond to medical emergencies and treat injuries.
requirements: Demonstrate knowledge of first aid requirements from Tenderfoot through First Class.
Explain how to get emergency help.
Define triage and its use.
Demonstrate CPR and AED use.
Complete a first aid scenario.

Camping.summary: Gain experience in planning and participating in camping activities.
requirements: Camp 20 nights under the sky.
Discuss tent care and maintenance.
Plan and cook meals outdoors.
Demonstrate Leave No Trace principles.
Identify gear needed for safe camping.

Citizenship in the Nation.summary: Understand the responsibilities of being a citizen in the United States.
requirements: Explain the meaning of citizenship in the nation.
Visit a federal facility and report on your visit.
Watch national news and discuss current events.
Explain the three branches of government.
Name your representatives in government.

Environmental Science.summary: Study the environment and learn how to protect it through observation and conservation.
requirements: Conduct experiments on air, water, and pollution.
Create a timeline of environmental history.
Explore endangered species and habitat protection.
Complete a conservation project.
Discuss global environmental challenges.

Personal Fitness.summary: Understand how to improve and maintain physical health.
requirements: Complete a physical exam and record progress.
Set personal health and fitness goals.
Demonstrate flexibility, strength, and endurance exercises.
Discuss substance abuse and its effects.
Track fitness improvement over 12 weeks.
